tool.name: UpwardContinuation

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input magnetic or gravity raster dataset for upward continuation processing.

param.name: height
param.dialogReference: Height above current observation level. Larger values provide more smoothing and noise reduction.

param.name: buffer_size
param.dialogReference: Buffer zone size for edge effect reduction. Recommend 20% of grid dimensions.

tool.summary: Upward continue magnetic/gravity data to higher observation levels for noise reduction and regional enhancement
tool.usage:
Upward continuation simulates the magnetic or gravity field at a higher observation level. This process attenuates high-frequency noise and short-wavelength anomalies while preserving regional trends. The tool applies an exponential decay filter exp(-k*height) in the frequency domain.

Common applications:

• Noise reduction in geophysical surveys

• Regional/residual separation

• Preparation for derivative calculations

• Cross-survey leveling and merging

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Upward continuation simulates magnetic or gravity field measurements at higher observation levels. This frequency domain technique attenuates high-frequency noise while preserving regional trends.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Noise reduction, regional enhancement, and data preparation for geophysical interpretation workflows.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Based on potential field theory (Blakely, 1995 - Potential Theory in Gravity and Magnetic Applications)
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Requires gridded magnetic or gravity data. Large continuation heights may over-smooth data. Buffer size should be approximately 20% of grid dimensions for optimal edge effect reduction.
